main event: Multiple incidents of unidentified aerial phenomena (UAP) were observed at Camp Hood, Texas, in May 1949 by credible military personnel and a civilian pilot.
interesting points: The UAP were observed on multiple occasions over a span of days, suggesting sustained activity in the area.
One UAP was described as the apparent size of an automobile headlight with a yellowish tinge, moving up and down and sideways to level flight.
Another UAP was described as 3 to 5 miles away, exhibiting slow movement and resembling a round object emitting a dull glow, orange in color, similar to a ball of fire.
No physical evidence or fragments were obtained from the UAP sightings, despite thorough search and investigation efforts.
There were no radar indications or extra noise on radio circuits observed during the airborne UAP sighting, indicating stealthy characteristics.
witnesses: credible military personnel and a civilian pilot
photographs: no photographs included in the report
